fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.env

Interface ConverterBuilder<P>

  • Type Parameters:
    P - the type of the parent builder (when calling Parent.and() method)
    All Superinterfaces:
    Builder<Converter>, Parent<P>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConverterBuilderDelegate, SimpleConverterBuilder

    public interface ConverterBuilder<P>
extends Parent<P>, Builder<Converter>
    Builder that configures how conversions are applied.

    The user can use the default converter and he can register a custom converter (register(SupportingConverter)).

    The user can override default converter to use its own implementation (override(Converter)).

    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Detail

      • override

        ConverterBuilder<P> override(Converter converter)
        Provide your own converter implementation.

        If you custom implementation also implements ConverterRegistry interface, you can still use register(SupportingConverter) to register specific converters. If it doesn't implement ConverterRegistry, calling register(SupportingConverter) has no effect.

        Parameters:
        converter - the custom converter to use
        Returns:
        this instance of fluent use

      • register

        ConverterBuilder<P> register(SupportingConverter converter)
        Register a custom converter. By default, DefaultConverter implementation is used. This implementation also implements ConverterRegistry. So any registered converter is registered in the ConverterRegistry.

        The DefaultConverter implementation delegates all conversions to registered SupportingConverters.

        If you don't want to use DefaultConverter but use your own implementation, use override(Converter) method.

        Parameters:
        converter - the converter to register into the ConverterRegistry
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining
